title: Pakistan’s T20 cricket league moved to UAE over India conflict
byline: Pakistan’s T20 cricket league will be relocated to the United Arab Emirates, officials said Friday, after Indian attacks on the country including a drone that reached Rawalpindi stadium.

title: Manchester United reach the Europa League final
byline: Manchester United and Tottenham will meet in an all-English Europa League final on 21 May.

title: President congratulates Pope Leo XIV
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake extended his warm congratulations to His Holiness Pope Leo XIV on his election as the new leader of the Catholic Church.

title: UPDATE: SLAF helicopter crashes into Maduru Oya during training exercise
byline: A Bell 212 helicopter belonging to the No. 7 Squadron of the Sri Lanka Air Force crashed into the Maduru Oya Reservoir during a training exercise this morning.

title: CBSL tightens oversight on IT and cybersecurity risks in banking sector
byline: In a move to reinforce operational resilience across the banking sector, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a new directive mandating licensed banks to promptly report a broad range of

title: Jacqueline Fernandez: Only Bollywood actress to own a private island ?
byline: Indian film stars are known for their opulent lifestyles, often flaunting private jets, luxury cars, and sprawling bungalows. Yet, one Bollywood actress stands out with an exceptionally rare asset — a private island.

title: Sri Pada pilgrim season ends
byline: Sri Pada pilgrim season 2024/25 will end on Vesak full moon Poya day on May 12.

title: Sri Lanka on heightened alert over possible implications
byline: Amid fears that India and Pakistan are on the brink of a wider conflict, Sri Lanka currently remains alert on possible implications for the country and its people, particularly for those studying and working in these two countries.

title: Has Chikungunya being contained?
byline: Despite health authorities issuing fresh guidelines to tackle the growing threat of Chikungunya, action on the ground tells a different story as it seems the fight against this mosquito-borne disease is more talk than walk.

title: IPL 2025 suspended indefinitely due to escalating India-Pak conflict
byline: The ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 has been suspended with immediate effect due to the heightened armed conflict between India and Pakistan following the terrorist strike on tourists in Pahalgam, as per media reports.

title: Govt to introduce mechanism to deal with child molesting cases: PM
byline: The Government is to introduce a mechanism to deal with child molesting cases brininging the relevant Ministries and other institutions together, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Parents of Kotahena school girl yet to meet me with petition: Women & Child Affairs Minister
byline: Minister of Women and Child Affairs Saroja Savithri Paulraj said that the parents of Kotahena school girl has not made a formal complaint as yet despite requests to do so.

title: Education Ministry in hot water over Kotahena child’s suicide
byline: A massive protest was staged in front of the Ramanathan Hindu Ladies’ College, Bambalapitiya on May 8 (Thursday) demanding justice for Dilshi Amshika, (15) a former student of the school who took her own life on April 29 as a result of the trauma she had to endure following alleged sexual and psychological abuse by her school mathematics teacher.

title: Update: Six die in Bell 212 helicopter crash in Maduru Oya
byline: At least six security forces personnel were killed when a Sri Lanka Air Force Bell 212 helicopter, operated by the No. 7 Squadron, crashed into the Maduru Oya Reservoir during a demonstration this morning.

title: Has Chikungunya been contained?
byline: Despite health authorities issuing fresh guidelines to tackle the growing threat of Chikungunya, action on the ground tells a different story as it seems the fight against this mosquito-borne disease is more talk than walk.

title: Bill Gates accuses Elon Musk of killing poor children
byline: Microsoft founder Bill Gates accused Elon Musk of killing poor children as he announced that he would give away 99% of his fortune over the next 20 years and that the Gates Foundation would cease operations by 2045.

title: Govt. to auction 27 luxury and decommissioned vehicles
byline: The Presidential Secretariat has commenced the second phase of bidding for the sale of 27 luxury and decommissioned vehicles, including BMW cars, V08 vehicles and Land Rover SUVs.

title: Court directs AG to explore resolution in national cricketers’ employee status dispute
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Attorney General to inform court whether there is a possibility of resolving the issues concerning Sri Lanka’s national cricket players, following their classification as employees of the national association, Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), by the Inland Revenue Department (IRD).

title: Don’t sensationalise Kotahena girl’s death: Bimal tells Opposition
byline: Claiming that the Opposition is trying to use the Kotahena girl’s death for political ends, Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake today urged the Opposition to refrain from politicising the girl’s death.

title: Teacher accused of molesting schoolgirl sent on compulsory leave: Ministry
byline: The teacher allegedly involved in the molestation of a schoolgirl from a leading school in Kotahena has been sent on compulsory leave following the submission of a police B report, the Ministry of Education confirmed today.

title: Divi Neguma officer sentenced to 20 years for soliciting sexual bribe
byline: A Development Officer with the Divi Neguma Department has been sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by Colombo High Court Judge Adithya Patabendige for soliciting a sexual bribe from the mother of a seven-year-old child suffering from kidney disease, in exchange for approving government financial aid for the child’s surgery.

title: UNP calls for unity in opposition at local bodies where they hold majority collectively
byline: United National Party (UNP) Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said that all the opposition parties should act in unison at the local authorities where they collectively hold majority.

title: Meat outlets, liquor shops to remain closed for Vesak
byline: All meat selling outlets, including supermarket meat counters, slaughterhouses, betting centres, casinos, nightclubs, and liquor outlets, will be closed on May 12, 13, and 14 in observance of Vesak, the Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs announced.

title: Australian ex-cricketer MacGill spared jail for cocaine supply
byline: Former Australian Test cricketer Stuart MacGill avoided jail time Friday when a Sydney judge sentenced him for taking part in the supply of cocaine.

title: Police Media Division OIC passes away at 52
byline: Chief Inspector W.A.D.N. Mahakumara, the Officer-in-Charge of the Police Media Division, passed away this morning at the age of 52.

title: Tutor accused in Kotahena school girl’s death provided police protection: MP
byline: The tutor who is accused in the Kotahena school girl’s death has been provided police protection, SJB MP Mujibur Rahman alleged yesterday.

title: Kotahena suicide incident: Maths tutor requests CID probe
byline: The maths tutor accused of verbally harassing the girl who committed suicide in Kotahena  requested an investigation into the allegations made against him and his institution.

title: Some opposition politicians linked to underworld gangs: Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today that investigations have revealed links between several underworld gangs and opposition politicians.

title: CSE ends in red on low trading activity
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the session with a subdued performance, ending on a negative note. Trading activity remained low throughout the day, as reflected by reduced volumes and turnover.

title: Redemption time in 2nd test
byline: The stage is set for a fiery showdown under floodlights at the Racecourse Stadium tomorrow as Sri Lanka prepares to take on the formidable New Zealand Under-85kg side in the second game of the tour.

title: British Airways plane caught fire after pilot forgot left and right
byline: A British Airways flight caught fire after a pilot confused his left and right hands during take-off.

title: Teachers’ Union slams Minister over comments on Kotahena schoolgirl’s death
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) has strongly criticized Minister of Women and Child Affairs Saroja Paulraj for remarks she made in Parliament regarding the tragic death of a Grade 10 student in Kotahena.
